config.segmentationDefinition: Segment the video at each clear narrative or visual transition that introduces a new marketing message, speaker, or brand moment. Segments should begin when there is a change in speaker, a shift in visual theme (e.g., logos, product shots, data center views, simulation footage, aircraft scenes), or the introduction of a new key message (e.g., quality of data, scale of infrastructure, customer benefit, real-world aviation use). Each segment should capture one distinct marketing idea or value point, ending when the focus transitions to the next theme.

Description.description: Detailed summary of the video segment, focusing on product characteristics, lighting, and color palette.

Genre.description: The overall genre of the segment (e.g., News, Comedy, Action, Documentary, Tutorial).

TargetAudience.description: The intended audience for this segment (e.g., Children, General Audience, Adults, Professionals).

ContentSafetyContainsProfanity.description: True if the audio contains profanity or inappropriate language.

ContentSafetyContentWarnings.description: List of sensitive topics present (e.g., Violence, Drug Use, Nudity, Hate Speech).

ContentSafetySuggestedRating.description: Suggested content rating (e.g., G, PG, PG-13, R).

AudioAnalysisKeyQuotes.description: Memorable or significant quotes spoken in the segment.

AudioAnalysisSpokenTopics.description: Key topics discussed in the dialog.

Description.description: A five-word description of the scene. A scene is a smaller segment of the segment where a continous block for storytelling unfolds within a specific time, place, and set of characters. A scene can only belong to a single chapter, and cannot overlap with other scenes. Scenes are sequential across the video.

StartTimestamp.description: the start timestamp of the scene

EndTimestamp.description: the end timestamp of the scene

Location.description: The specific location, setting, city, or landmark visible in the scene.

EraEstimatedYear.description: The estimated year or decade of the scene.

EraReasoning.description: Evidence for the era estimate based on visual cues like clothing, technology, cars, or architecture.

Brands.description: Comma-separated list of visible commercial brands, logos, or prominent product placements.

Celebrities.description: Comma-separated list of names of famous public figures or celebrities present in the scene.

ShotType.description: The camera shot type (e.g., Close-up, Wide Shot, Bird's Eye View, Portrait, Drone Shot).

ColorScheme.description: The dominant color palette, lighting mood, or aesthetic style (e.g., Noir, Vibrant, Pastel, High Contrast).

IsSignatureMoment.description: Indicates if this scene contains a visually striking or iconic moment suitable for a thumbnail or trailer intro.
